docTitle.titlePart:
SELF-CROSSLINKING POLYMERIC DISPERSANTS AND THEIR USE IN
EMULSION POLYMERISATION

front.docAuthor: A J P Bückmann, T Nabuurs, G C Overbeek

byline.affiliation: International Waterborne, High Solids, and Powder Coatings Symposium

Symposium Sponsored by
The University of Southern Mississippi
Department of Polymer Science

front.div:
ABSTRACT
In this paper a novel self-crosslinking polymeric dispersant is described. The performance of
this dispersant is compared to conventional surfactants and to existing polymeric stabilisers.
The self–crosslinking dispersant is used to prepare surfactant free acrylic dispersions with a
core-shell particle morphology, where the shell polymer is the self-crosslinking polymeric
dispersant providing stabilisation of the polymer particle. The phase ratio's and the
magnitude in which the Tg's of the polymeric dispersant and the subsequently formed
polymer differ were found to be of crucial importance to obtain a very low MFT and hence
very good film formation combined with very high hardness and good anti blocking
properties. In addition films cast from these dispersions have excellent chemical resistances,
which make these dispersions very useful as binders for high performance coating systems.
